result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John D. Koenig

defendant.name: Koenig, John D.
defendant.address: 618 S Barstow St, Eau Claire, WI 54701

records.addlTxt:
1:57 PM cases 21CF1233, 21CF1321, 21CM836, 22CF436, 22CF467 called. Defendant John D. Koenig in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for John D. Koenig.  Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
In 21CF1233: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the Information. 
In 21CF1321: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2 as charged in the Information. 
In 22CF467: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping (no repeater). 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 

Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 3 years with conditions: 
Defendant to participate in and successfully complete Eau Claire County Treatment Court. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide a DNA sample. Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
No contact with Officer Lokkesmoe or Officer Asselin outside of their official capacities. 
No contact with Racy Delane's Coffee, Shenanigans or The Pickle on Water Street. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
As to count 2 in 21CF1321: 9 months in Jail all except 30 days Stayed pending further order of the court. 
If revoked, defendant has 5 days credit in 21CF1233, 3 days in 21CF1321, 2 days in 22CF467.

9:34 AM cases 21CM836, 21CM1321, 22CF436, 22CF467 21CF1233 called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant John D. Koenig in court in custody with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in all files where it was not previously waived. 

Branch 1 for further scheduling for possible plea/sentencing hearing.
Defendant's letter to Court regarding counsel, court date, and revocation.

9:33 AM Cases called: 21CF1233, 21CF1321, 21CM836, 22CF436 & 22CF467. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John D. Koenig in court in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for John D. Koenig. 

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in each felony files and Court accepts waiver. 
Cases referred to Br. 1 to set arraignment. 21CM836 will ride along.

9:42 AM cases 22CF436, 21CM836, 21CF1233, 22CF467, 21CF1321 called. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John D. Koenig in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for John D. Koenig. 
There is an offer from the State the defendant needs to discuss with Attorney Thorson.
Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
